title: 'I have some gas left in the tank': At 37, Djokovic still has big tennis goals
description: Djokovic has had a rough start to 2025, but shown flashes of brilliance too. And he's aiming for that 100th tour win.
author: Simon Cambers

title: WTA's Dart rues requesting foe 'put on deodorant'
description: Harriet Dart apologized after her 6-0, 6-3 loss at the Rouen Open on Tuesday for saying that her opponent, Lois Boisson, "smells really bad."

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Thiem on Fonseca & Mensik: ‚ÄòI could watch them every week‚Äô
description: Dominic Thiem is having little trouble settling into life without competing on the ATP Tour, but that does not mean a life without tennis. The former No. 3 in the PIF ATP Rankings and 17-time tour-level champion was in Munich on Tuesday at the BMW Open by Bitpanda, where he tossed the coin for defending champion Jan-Lennard Struff‚Äôs first-round match against Francisco Cerundolo. He then settled into a courtside seat in the sun to watch some of the Tuesday action unfold at the clay-court ATP 500. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm enjoying retirement. It‚Äôs nice,‚Äù Thiem told ATPTour.com. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm completely in a different department now, with my company, with renewable energy, but of course I‚Äôll always remain in tennis, and I love the sport. It‚Äôs really nice to see a tournament from a different perspective, and I‚Äôm enjoying it a lot.‚Äù Welcome back @domithiem ü§óü™ô@Struffitennis üÜö @FranCerundolo is ON!@BMWOpen500 | #BMWOpen pic.twitter.com/PK9hJHb7MP‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) April 15, 2025 Thiem was speaking from the stands as he prepared to watch #NextGenATP Diego Dedura-Palomero take on Denis Shapovalov in Munich. He has also continued to follow the ATP Tour from afar since he played the final event of his pro career last October in Vienna. He said that his retirement has, in some ways, changed his relationship with tennis for the better. ‚ÄúI love to watch it. I was always a big fan of the sport, and when you are a pro player it is not that relaxing sometimes to watch, because you are always scared someone can overtake you in the rankings or whatever,‚Äù said the 2020 US Open titlist. ‚ÄúNow I can watch every match very relaxed. For example, I am now seeing Diego for the first time, which is super interesting. It‚Äôs just really nice to sit here and watch some good tennis from a different position.‚Äù The Austrian identified Jakub Mensik and Joao Fonseca as two of the ATP Tour‚Äôs young stars that keep him coming back as a TV spectator, although he also cited the emergence of even newer talent as something that excites him. ‚ÄúMensik and Fonseca are amazing. I love to watch them,‚Äù said Thiem. ‚ÄúThey already made it. There is no question they are really going to be at the top. Mensik won Miami, Fonseca already won Buenos Aires. They are already at the top, and now it‚Äôs really interesting to see players like Diego and Justin Engel because they are still a little bit lower ranked. Mensik and Fonseca, I could watch them every week on the TV, but it‚Äôs also interesting to watch somebody for the first time.‚Äù The 17-year-old Dedura-Palomero did not disappoint Thiem on Tuesday. The Berlin native, who became the first player born in 2008 or later to compete in an ATP Tour match, led Shapovalov 7-6(2), 3-0 when the Canadian retired. It was the sort of breakthrough moment that Thiem admits he misses from his playing days. ‚ÄúI miss the feeling after a great victory or after a tournament victory,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThose are the moments which are priceless, and also are never going to come back. The feeling is unbelievable, but I really don‚Äôt miss all the work to actually come to those moments. To be in the position for those winning feelings, it‚Äôs a very long and very hard road. I know what it takes and I‚Äôm not missing that part at all, so it‚Äôs a good combination.‚Äù [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What is the Munich tennis schedule?
description: The BMW Open by Bitpanda continues Wednesday in Munich. Two-time champion and top seed Alexander Zverev faces countryman Daniel Altmaier. American Ben Shelton is also in action. View Wednesday's full order of play below (how to watch).¬† ORDER OF PLAY - WEDNESDAY, 16 APRIL 2025 Center Court - start 11:00 Luciano Darderi (ITA) vs Miomir Kecmanovic (SRB) [LL] Botic van de Zandschulp (NED) vs [2] Ben Shelton (USA) [1] Alexander Zverev (GER) vs [WC] Daniel Altmaier (GER) Tallon Griekspoor (NED) vs [WC] Yannick Hanfmann (GER) Court 1 - start 11:00 [Q] Justin Engel (GER) / Max Hans Rehberg (GER) vs [2] Marcel Granollers (ESP) / Horacio Zeballos (ARG) [1] Kevin Krawietz (GER) / Tim Puetz (GER) vs Yuki Bhambri (IND) / Robert Galloway (USA) [WC] Jakob Schnaitter (GER) / Mark Wallner (GER) vs Rafael Matos (BRA) / Marcelo Melo (BRA) Not Before 17:00 [Alt] Guido Andreozzi (ARG) / Theo Arribage (FRA) vs [3] Christian Harrison (USA) / Evan King (USA) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Dart apologises for asking Boisson to 'put on deodorant'
description: British number four Harriet Dart apologises after asking the umpire to tell her opponent to put on deodorant during her first-round loss at the Rouen Open.

title: Norrie beaten in Barcelona, Alcaraz edges out Quinn
description: British number three Cameron Norrie suffers a first-round exit at the Barcelona Open as he prepares for the start of the French Open this month.

title: Alcaraz Wins 2025 Monte Carlo Title
description: Carlos Alcaraz claimed his sixth Masters 1000 crown and first Monte-Carlo title on Sunday, overpowering a fading Lorenzo Musetti 3-6, 6-1, 6-0. The Spaniard weathered a fiery first set from Musetti, but the Italian‚Äôs right leg buckled in the third, requiring treatment at 0-3. Alcaraz, clinical as ever, seized the moment, wrapping it up in ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: Monte-Carlo Masters 2025 Day 7 Semi-Final Recap
description: Day 7 at the Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters boiled the tournament down to its final two, with Carlos Alcaraz and Lorenzo Musetti earning their spots in Sunday‚Äôs championship match. Alcaraz produced a cleaner display to oust Alejandro Davidovich Fokina in an entertaining 7-6(2), 6-4 clash, overcoming a spraying some forehands and five missed match points to ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan
